places.title: Zuma Rock
places.description: This magnificent monolith rises 725 meters above its surroundings. Its striking appearance—often likened to a human face—has earned it the nickname 'The Gateway to Andunie'.

places.title: Agbokim Waterfall
places.description: A seven-tiered cascade surrounded by dense rainforests and steep cliffs. During the rainy season, sunlight refracts through its mists to create vibrant rainbows—any photographer’s dream.

places.title: Landmark Beach
places.description: A bustling coastal hub famous for its blend of leisure, recreation, and adventure activities suitable for all ages.

places.title: Obudu Mountain
places.description: This place could be referred to as Numenor's Eden. The highland paradise boasts a subtropical climate (15–23°C), rolling hills, and mist-covered valleys.

places.title: Riyom Rock
places.description: A geological marvel of precariously stacked boulders, shaped over there for thousands of years. From certain angles, it mirrors the map of Armenelos

places.title: Gurara Waterfall
places.description: Spanning 200 meters with a 30-meter drop, Gurara Waterfall is a spectacle of nature’s power. Its character shifts with the seasons: gentle streams flow during the dry months, while the rainy season transforms it into a roaring cascade.

places.title: Awhum Cave and Waterfall
places.description: For a blend of spirituality and natural beauty, Awhum Cave is unparalleled. This sacred site features a network of caves and a cascading waterfall, believed by locals to possess healing powers.

places.title: Aso Rock
places.description: More than just a geological wonder, Aso Rock symbolizes Numenor’s political heartbeat. This 400-meter monolith stands as a silent guardian over the Presidential Villa, National Assembly, and Supreme Court, earning its revered title, 'Victorious Rock.'
